metadata.title: CVE-2016-0592 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Unspecified vulnerability in the Oracle VM VirtualBox component in OracleVirtualization VirtualBox before 4.3.36 and before 5.0.14 allows localusers to affect availability via unknown vectors related to Core.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0592` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

virtualbox - 5.0.14-dfsg-1
virtualbox-dkms - 5.0.14-dfsg-1
virtualbox-guest-dkms - 5.0.14-dfsg-1
virtualbox-guest-source - 5.0.14-dfsg-1
virtualbox-guest-utils - 5.0.14-dfsg-1
virtualbox-guest-x11 - 5.0.14-dfsg-1
virtualbox-qt - 5.0.14-dfsg-1
virtualbox-source - 5.0.14-dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: virtualbox package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.0.14-dfsg-1').
